intro: Phyllanthus christophersenii, commonly known as the Christensen's phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually opposite or whorled, with a distinctive shape and a waxy texture. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
